memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, EvolvingP< T > XEv, GradientsP< T > XGrad, T *zb)
memberdef.name: gradientCPU

briefdescription.para: CPU function to compute gradients for all evolving parameters, handle halo regions, and apply wet-dry fixes. Calculates spatial derivatives for height, surface elevation, and velocity components. Also manages halo regions and applies wet-dry fixes if necessary.

parameterdescription.para: Gradient storage for the evolving parameters

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T > XBlock, T *a, T *dadx, T *dady)
memberdef.name: gradientC

briefdescription.para: CPU function for calculating gradients using the minmod limiter. Computes spatial derivatives in x and y directions for a given variable.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, T *a, T *dadx, T *dady)
memberdef.name: gradientHalo

briefdescription.para: CPU function to compute gradients at the halo boundaries of all active blocks. This function iterates over all active blocks and computes the gradients at their halo boundaries using finite difference approximations.

parameterdescription.para: Array containing the variable for which gradients are to be computed
Array to store the computed x-derivative gradients
Array to store the computed y-derivative gradients

simplesect.para: This function calls specific functions to handle each of the four halo boundaries (left, right, bottom, top) for each block. It ensures that gradients are accurately computed at the edges of the computational domain, which is crucial for maintaining solution accuracy and stability. The function assumes that the input arrays are properly allocated and sized according to the simulation parameters. The gradient computations are performed using central differences where possible, and one-sided differences at the boundaries. The function is templated to support different data types (e.g., float, double).

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, EvolvingP< T > XEv, GradientsP< T > XGrad, T *zb)
memberdef.name: gradientGPU

briefdescription.para: Entry point for gradient of evolving variables calculation on the GPU.

detaileddescription.para: Calculates gradients of evolving variables using CUDA kernels and synchronizes device operations. Handles halo filling and elevation conservation if required.

T
Data type (float or double)
XParam
Simulation parameters
XBlock
Block parameters
XEv
Evolving variables
XGrad
Gradient variables
zb
Bed elevation array
Wrapping function to calculate gradien of evolving variables on GPU This function is the entry point to the gradient functions on the GPU

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, EvolvingP< T > XEv, GradientsP< T > XGrad, T *zb)
memberdef.name: gradientGPUnew

briefdescription.para: Alternative GPU gradient calculation using shared memory kernels and CUDA streams.

detaileddescription.para: Uses gradientSMC kernels and handles halo filling, elevation conservation, and wet/dry prolongation.

memberdef.argsstring: (int halowidth, int *active, int *level, T theta, T dx, T *a, T *dadx, T *dady)
memberdef.name: gradient

briefdescription.para: Device kernel for calculating gradients for an evolving parameter using the minmod limiter.

detaileddescription.para: Computes spatial derivatives in x and y directions for a given variable.

memberdef.argsstring: (int halowidth, int *active, int *level, T theta, T dx, T *a, T *dadx, T *dady)
memberdef.name: gradientSM

briefdescription.para: Deprecated shared memory device kernel for gradient calculation.

detaileddescription.para: Uses shared memory for stencil operations; slower than the standard kernel.

memberdef.argsstring: (int halowidth, int *active, int *level, T theta, T dx, T *a, T *dadx, T *dady)
memberdef.name: gradientSMB

briefdescription.para: Shared memory device kernel for gradient calculation (variant B).

detaileddescription.para: Uses a fixed shared memory tile for stencil operations; only computes gradients for interior points.

memberdef.argsstring: (int halowidth, int *active, int *level, T theta, T dx, T *a, T *dadx, T *dady)
memberdef.name: gradientSMC

briefdescription.para: Shared memory device kernel for gradient calculation (variant C).

detaileddescription.para: Uses a flat shared memory array for stencil operations; computes gradients for all points.

memberdef.argsstring: (int halowidth, int *active, int *level, T theta, T dx, T *a, T *dadx)
memberdef.name: gradientedgeX

briefdescription.para: Device kernel for calculating gradients for an evolving parameter using the minmod limiter only at a fixed column (i.e. fixed ix).

detaileddescription.para: Computes x-derivative for a specific column using the minmod limiter.

memberdef.argsstring: (int halowidth, int *active, int *level, T theta, T dx, T *a, T *dady)
memberdef.name: gradientedgeY

briefdescription.para: Device kernel for calculating gradients for an evolving parameter using the minmod limiter only at a fixed row (i.e. fixed iy).

detaileddescription.para: Computes y-derivative for a specific row using the minmod limiter.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, T *a, T *dadx, T *dady)
memberdef.name: gradientHaloGPU

briefdescription.para: GPU function to compute gradients at the halo boundaries of all active blocks. This function launches CUDA kernels to compute the gradients at the halo boundaries of all active blocks using parallel processing.

parameterdescription.para: Array containing the variable for which gradients are to be computed
Array to store the computed x-derivative gradients
Array to store the computed y-derivative gradients

simplesect.para: This function sets up the CUDA grid and block dimensions and launches specific kernels to handle each of the four halo boundaries (left, right, bottom, top) for all active blocks. It ensures that gradients are accurately computed at the edges of the computational domain, which is crucial for maintaining solution accuracy and stability. The function assumes that the input arrays are properly allocated and sized according to the simulation parameters. The gradient computations are performed using central differences where possible, and one-sided differences at the boundaries. The function is templated to support different data types (e.g., float, double).

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, EvolvingP< T > XEv, GradientsP< T > XGrad, T *zb)
memberdef.name: WetsloperesetXGPU

briefdescription.para: Device kernel to apply wet slope limiters to gradients of surface elevation in the x-direction. Adjusts x-derivative gradients to prevent non-physical slopes in wet-dry transition zones.

parameterdescription.para: Gradient storage for the evolving parameters

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, EvolvingP< T > XEv, GradientsP< T > XGrad, T *zb)
memberdef.name: WetsloperesetYGPU

briefdescription.para: Device kernel to apply wet slope limiters to gradients of surface elevation in the y-direction. Adjusts y-derivative gradients to prevent non-physical slopes in wet-dry transition zones.

parameterdescription.para: Gradient storage for the evolving parameters

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, EvolvingP< T > XEv, GradientsP< T > XGrad, T *zb)
memberdef.name: WetsloperesetHaloLeftGPU

briefdescription.para: Device kernel to apply wet slope limiters to gradients of surface elevation at the left halo boundary. Adjusts x-derivative gradients to prevent non-physical slopes in wet-dry transition zones.

parameterdescription.para: Gradient storage for the evolving parameters

simplesect.para: This kernel specifically handles the left halo boundary, where special care is needed due to the absence of neighboring blocks on that side. The logic accounts for various configurations of neighboring blocks to correctly compute the left surface elevation needed for the wet slope limiter.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, EvolvingP< T > XEv, GradientsP< T > XGrad, T *zb)
memberdef.name: WetsloperesetHaloRightGPU

briefdescription.para: Device kernel to apply wet slope limiters to gradients of surface elevation at the right halo boundary. Adjusts x-derivative gradients to prevent non-physical slopes in wet-dry transition zones.

parameterdescription.para: Gradient storage for the evolving parameters

simplesect.para: This kernel specifically handles the right halo boundary, where special care is needed due to the absence of neighboring blocks on that side. The logic accounts for various configurations of neighboring blocks to correctly compute the right surface elevation needed for the wet slope limiter.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, EvolvingP< T > XEv, GradientsP< T > XGrad, T *zb)
memberdef.name: WetsloperesetHaloBotGPU

briefdescription.para: GPU kernel to reset the wet slope limiter at the bottom halo boundary. Adjusts y-derivative gradients to prevent non-physical slopes in wet-dry transition zones.

parameterdescription.para: Gradient storage for the evolving parameters

simplesect.para: This kernel specifically handles the bottom halo boundary, where special care is needed due to the absence of neighboring blocks on that side. The logic accounts for various configurations of neighboring blocks to correctly compute the bottom surface elevation needed for the wet slope limiter.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, EvolvingP< T > XEv, GradientsP< T > XGrad, T *zb)
memberdef.name: WetsloperesetHaloTopGPU

briefdescription.para: GPU kernel to reset the wet slope limiter at the top halo boundary. Adjusts y-derivative gradients to prevent non-physical slopes in wet-dry transition zones.

parameterdescription.para: Gradient storage for the evolving parameters

simplesect.para: This kernel specifically handles the top halo boundary, where special care is needed due to the absence of neighboring blocks on that side. The logic accounts for various configurations of neighboring blocks to correctly compute the top surface elevation needed for the wet slope limiter.

memberdef.argsstring: (Param XParam, BlockP< T >XBlock, T *a, T *dadx, T *dady)
memberdef.name: gradientHaloLeftGPU

briefdescription.para: GPU kernel to compute the gradient at the left halo boundary of blocks. This kernel calculates the x and y derivatives at the left edge of each block using finite difference approximations, taking into account the presence of neighboring blocks and their levels.

parameterdescription.para: Array containing the variable for which gradients are to be computed
Array to store the computed x-derivative gradients
Array to store the computed y-derivative gradients

simplesect.para: This kernel handles various configurations of neighboring blocks, including cases where neighboring blocks are at different levels of refinement
